summary: Internal email chain among US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) personnel discussing how to handle document requests from Jeffrey Epstein's defense team following his death. The requests are being made under the Department's Touhy regulations, and the decision is to refer them to the Civil Division.

events.title: Defense Team Submits Document Requests
events.description: Epstein's defense lawyers send document requests to the USAO SDNY related to his death, prompting internal discussion on how to handle them.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The document references Epstein's death, which is the subject of the defense team's document requests.

keyFacts: Epstein's defense team was actively seeking documents related to his death in August 2019, shortly after he died.
The USAO SDNY internally debated whether to ignore the requests or refer them to the Civil Division, noting there was 'no right to anything' as no proceeding was pending related to the death.
The requests were made under the Department of Justice's Touhy regulations, which govern how federal employees respond to subpoenas and requests for information.
The defense intended to serve requests separately on the MCC and the FBI, but provided copies to the USAO SDNY as a courtesy.
The email chain shows coordination within the USAO SDNY to assign a Civil Division AUSA as the point of contact for the defense lawyers' requests.
